subject: Horse Racing
Kentucky Derby
Horses
lead_paragraph: Lil E. Tee, who upset the heavily favored Arazi to win the 1992 Kentucky Derby, has died. He was 20. The horse was euthanized at Old Frankfort Stud in Lexington, Ky., on March 18. The farm said the horse fell ill last month after an operation to repair an obstructed bowel. Lil E. Tee needed lifesaving stomach surgery as a yearling, dimming his racing prospects. Owned by W. Cal Partee and trained by Lynn Whiting, Lil E. Tee, with Pat Day riding, captured the Derby at 17-1 odds. He was retired as a 4-year-old, having won seven of 13 career starts.
